alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 5:28PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Cherokee County through 600 PM CDT... At 528 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northeast of Little River Falls to near Little River Canyon National Preserve. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cedar Bluff, Little River Canyon National Preserve, Gaylesville, Cornwall Furnace Park, Blanche, Little River Falls, Eastern Weiss Lake, Western Weiss Lake, Fullerton, New Moon, Broomtown, Waterhouse, Chesterfield and Little River Canyon NP. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northeastern Alabama.
